sentences.chinese: 在剧中，他出演一位船工。

sentences.english: Our ship-building industry has been expanding rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 我们造船工业有了迅速发展。

sentences.english: Cu-Ni-Cr-Mn cast steel is a kind of low alloyed high tensile steel, which is used in ship industry.
sentences.chinese: 铜镍铬锰铸钢是一种高强度低合金钢，用于造船工业。

sentences.english: The first chapter mainly analyzes the novels of"boatman series".
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要分析陈应松的“船工系列”小说。

sentences.english: The boaters bailed water out from their sinking boat.
sentences.chinese: 船工们从正在下沉的船里往外戽水。

sentences.english: The boatmen pulled their boat onto the sand.
Mentions the boatman worker's chant, our young friend possibly not too understood.
sentences.chinese: 说起船工号子，我们年轻的朋友可能不太了解。

sentences.english: Another man then ran to the river and jumped on the log with Darrell.
sentences.chinese: 另一个船工跑向河边，纵身一跃和达瑞尔站在了一起。

sentences.english: It is our great pleasure to note that our shipbuilding industry is developing vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴地看到，我国的造船工业正在蓬勃发展。

sentences.english: It is our great pleasure to note that our shipping industry is developing vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常高兴地看到，我国的造船工业正在蓬勃发展。

definition: person who lives and makes a living on a boat/boatman/boat dweller
to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
people who live and make a living on boats
